data.name: DisablingCodeCoverageInAppContainerTestExecution
data.value: Code coverage is not available for Windows Store apps. Code coverage analysis skipped for this test run.

data.value: Code coverage is not available for Windows Phone apps. Code coverage analysis skipped for this test run.

data.name: DisablingDataCollectionInAppContainerTestExecution
data.value: Diagnostic data adapters are not supported when running unit tests for Windows Store apps. Remove diagnostic data adapters settings from settings.

data.value: Diagnostic data adapters are not supported when running unit tests for Windows Phone apps. Remove diagnostic data adapters settings from settings.

data.value: Reading diagnostic data adapter settings threw an running '{0}'. All diagnostic data adapters will be skipped in this run.

data.name: DuplicateArgumentError
data.value: The parameter "{0}" should be provided only once.

data.name: EnableCodeCoverageArgumentProcessorHelp
data.value: /EnableCodeCoverage Enables data collector 'CodeCoverage' for the test run.

data.name: EnableDiagUsage
data.value:
--Diag|/Diag:<Path to log file> Enable logs for test platform. Logs are written to the provided file.
Change the trace level for logs as shown below Example: /Diag:<Path to log file>;tracelevel=<Defaults to "verbose"> Allowed values for tracelevel: off, error, warning, info and verbose.

data.name: EnableLoggersArgumentHelp
data.value:
--logger|/logger:<Logger Uri/FriendlyName> Specify a logger for test results. For example, to log results into a Visual Studio Test Results File (TRX) use /logger:trx[;LogFileName=<Defaults to unique file name>] Creates file in TestResults directory with given LogFileName.
Change the verbosity level in log messages for console logger as shown below Example: /logger:console;verbosity=<Defaults to "normal"> Allowed values for verbosity: quiet, minimal, normal and detailed.
Change the diagnostic level prefix for console logger as shown below Example: /logger:console;prefix=<Defaults to "false"> More info on Console Logger here : https://aka.ms/console-logger

data.name: ErrorMessageBanner
data.value: Error Message:

data.name: Examples
data.value: To run tests: >vstest.console.exe tests.dll To run tests with additional settings such as data collectors: >vstest.console.exe tests.dll /Settings:Local.RunSettings

data.name: ExceptionFromExtension
data.value: Exception occurred when instantiating extension '{0}': {1}

data.name: FailedTestIndicator
data.value: Failed
data.comment: Message which is written to the console when a test fails.

data.name: FileNotFound
data.value: '{0}' not found.

data.name: Framework35NotSupported
data.value: Framework35 is not supported. For projects targeting .Net Framework 3.5, test will run in CLR 4.0 "compatibility mode".

data.name: FrameworkArgumentHelp
data.value: --Framework|/Framework:<Framework Version> Target .Net Framework version to be used for test execution. Valid values are ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5.1", ".NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0" etc. Other supported values are Framework40, Framework45, FrameworkCore10 and FrameworkUap10.

data.name: FrameworkVersionRequired
data.value: The /Framework argument requires the target .Net Framework version for the test run. Example: /Framework:".NETFramework,Version=v4.5.1"

data.name: HelpArgumentHelp
data.value: -?|--Help|/?|/Help Display this usage message.

data.name: HelpArgumentsText
data.value: Arguments:

data.name: HelpDescriptionText
data.value: Description: Runs tests from the specified files.

data.name: HelpOptionsText
data.value: Options:
data.comment: Section Header for subsequent command help listing

data.name: HelpUsageText
data.value: Usage: vstest.console.exe [Arguments] [Options] [[--] <RunSettings arguments>...]]

data.name: Hours
data.value: Hours

data.name: InIsolationHelp
data.value: --InIsolation|/InIsolation Runs the tests in an isolated process. This makes vstest.console.exe process less likely to be stopped on an error in the tests, but tests may run slower.

data.name: InvalidBatchSize
data.value: Invalid batch size {0}. The batch size should be greater than zero. Example: /BatchSize:10

data.name: InvalidConfiguration
data.value: The given configuration is invalid.

data.name: InvalidEnableCodeCoverageCommand
data.value: Argument {0} is not expected in the 'EnableCodeCoverage' command. Specify the command without the argument (Example: vstest.console.exe myTests.dll /EnableCodeCoverage) and try again.

data.name: InvalidFrameworkVersion
data.value: Invalid .Net Framework version:{0}. Please give the fullname of the TargetFramework(Example: .NETCoreApp,Version=v2.0). Other supported .Net Framework versions are Framework40, Framework45, FrameworkCore10 and FrameworkUap10.

data.name: InvalidInIsolationCommand
data.value: Argument {0} is not expected in the 'InIsolation' command. Specify the command without the argument (Example: vstest.console.exe myTests.dll /InIsolation) and try again.

data.name: InvalidParallelCommand
data.value: Argument {0} is not expected in the 'Parallel' command. Specify the command without the argument (Example: vstest.console.exe myTests.dll /Parallel) and try again.

data.name: InvalidParentProcessIdArgument
data.value: The --ParentProcessId|/ParentProcessId argument requires the process id which is an integer. Specify the process id of the parent process that launched this process.

data.name: InvalidPlatformType
data.value: Invalid platform type:{0}. Valid platform types are x86, x64 and Arm.

data.name: InvalidPortArgument
data.value: The --Port|/Port argument requires the port number which is an integer. Specify the port for socket connection and receiving the event messages.

data.value: The path '{0}' specified in the 'TestAdapterPath' is invalid. Error: {1}

data.name: InvalidTestCaseFilterValueForSpecificTests
data.value: The /TestCaseFilter argument cannot be specified with /Tests. Filtering of test cases is not applicable when tests are specified.

data.name: InvalidUseVsixExtensionsCommand
data.value: Argument {0} is not expected in the 'UseVsixExtensions' command. Specify the command indicating whether the vsix extensions should be used or skipped (Example: vstest.console.exe myTests.dll /UseVsixExtensions:true) and try again.

data.name: ParallelArgumentProcessorHelp
data.value: --Parallel|/Parallel Specifies that the tests be executed in parallel. By default up to all available cores on the machine may be used. The number of cores to use may be configured using a settings file.

data.name: RunSpecificTestsHelp
data.value: --Tests|/Tests:<Test Names> Run tests with names that match the provided values. To provide multiple values, separate them by commas. Examples: /Tests:TestMethod1 /Tests:TestMethod1,testMethod2
data.comment: Please verify if the console output looks good after modifiaction.

data.name: RunTestsArgumentHelp
data.value: [TestFileNames] Run tests from the specified files or wild card pattern. Separate multiple test file names or pattern by spaces. Set console logger verbosity to detailed to view matched test files. Examples: mytestproject.dll mytestproject.dll myothertestproject.exe testproject*.dll my*project.dll

data.value: Supported File Types:

data.name: SwitchToIsolationInAppContainerMode
data.value: Using Isolation mode to run unit tests for Windows Store apps. Use the /InIsolation parameter to suppress this warning.

data.name: SwitchToIsolationInMultiTargetingMode
data.value: Using Isolation mode to run tests as required by effective Platform:{0} and .Net Framework:{1} settings for test run. Use the /inIsolation parameter to suppress this warning.

data.name: SwitchToIsolationInPhoneAppContainerMode
data.value: Using Isolation mode to run unit tests for Windows Phone apps. Use the /InIsolation parameter to suppress this warning.

data.name: SwitchToNoIsolation
data.value: Using Isolation mode to run the tests as diagnostic data adapters were enabled in the runsettings. Use the /inIsolation parameter to suppress this warning.

data.name: TestAdapterPathDoesNotExist
data.value: The custom test adapter search path provided was not found, provide a valid path and try again.

data.name: TestAdapterPathHelp
data.value: --TestAdapterPath|/TestAdapterPath This makes vstest.console.exe process use custom test adapters from a given path (if any) in the test run. Example /TestAdapterPath:<pathToCustomAdapters>

data.name: TestAdapterPathValueRequired
data.value: The /TestAdapterPath parameter requires a value, which is path of a location containing custom test adapters. Example: /TestAdapterPath:c:\MyCustomAdapters

data.name: TestCaseFilterArgumentHelp
data.value: --TestCaseFilter|/TestCaseFilter:<Expression> Run tests that match the given expression. <Expression> is of the format <property>Operator<value>[|&<Expression>] where Operator is one of =, != or ~ (Operator ~ has 'contains' semantics and is applicable for string properties like DisplayName). Parenthesis () can be used to group sub-expressions. Examples: /TestCaseFilter:"Priority=1" /TestCaseFilter:"(FullyQualifiedName~Nightly |Name=MyTestMethod)"

data.name: TestCaseFilterValueRequired
data.value: The /TestCaseFilter argument requires the filter value. Filter value can be <property>=<value> type. Examples: "Priority=1", "TestCategory=Nightly"

data.name: TestRunFailed
data.value: Test Run Failed.

data.name: TestRunSuccessful
data.value: Test Run Successful.

data.name: TestSettingsFrameworkMismatch
data.value: Using framework {0} to run the tests. Specify /Framework:{1} to suppress this warning.

data.name: TimeElapsed

data.name: UseVsixExtensionsHelp
data.value: /UseVsixExtensions This makes vstest.console.exe process use or skip the VSIX extensions installed(if any) in the test run. Example /UseVsixExtensions:true

data.name: UseVsixExtensionsValueRequired
data.value: The /UseVsixExtensions parameter requires a value. If 'true', the installed VSIX extensions (if any) will be used in the test run. If false, they will be ignored. Example: /UseVsixExtensions:true

data.name: CLIRunSettingsArgumentHelp
data.value: RunSettings arguments: Arguments to pass runsettings configurations through commandline. Arguments may be specified as name-value pair of the form [name]=[value] after "-- ". Note the space after --. Use a space to separate multiple [name]=[value]. More info on RunSettings arguments support: https://aka.ms/vstest-runsettings-arguments

data.name: MalformedRunSettingsKey
data.value: One or more runsettings provided contain invalid token

data.name: ResultsDirectoryArgumentHelp
data.value: --ResultsDirectory|/ResultsDirectory Test results directory will be created in specified path if not exists. Example /ResultsDirectory:<pathToResultsDirectory>

data.name: ResultsDirectoryValueRequired
data.value: The /ResultsDirectory parameter requires a value, where the test results should be saved. Example: /ResultsDirectory:c:\MyTestResultsDirectory

data.name: InvalidResultsDirectoryPathCommand
data.value: The path '{0}' specified in the 'ResultsDirectory' is invalid. Error: {1}

data.name: InIsolationDeprecated
data.value: The /InIsolation flag is deprecated. The tests are always run in a separate process

data.value: The Data Collector friendly name '{0}' is not valid. The Data Collector will be ignored.

data.name: DbgTrcMessagesBanner
data.value: Debug Traces Messages:

data.name: OpenResponseFileError
data.value: Error opening response file '{0}'

data.name: ResponseFileArgumentHelp
data.value: @<file> Read response file for more options.

data.name: EnableBlameUsage
data.value: --Blame|/Blame:[CollectDump];[CollectAlways]=[Value];[DumpType]=[Value] Runs the test in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating the problematic test causing test host crash. It creates an output file in the current directory as "Sequence.xml", that captures the order of execution of test before the crash. You may optionally choose to collect process dump for the test host. When you choose to collect dump, by default, a mini dump will be collected on a crash. You may also choose to override this default behaviour by some optional parameters: CollectAlways - To collect dump on exit even if there is no crash (true/false) DumpType - To specify dump type (mini/full). Example: /Blame /Blame:CollectDump /Blame:CollectDump;CollectAlways=true;DumpType=full

data.name: TestRunAborted
data.value: Test Run Aborted.

data.value: Test Run Canceled.

data.name: TestRunSummaryForCanceledOrAbortedRun

data.name: UseVsixExtensionsDeprecation
data.value: /UseVsixExtensions is getting deprecated. Please use /TestAdapterPath instead.

data.name: DisableAutoFakesUsage
data.value: --DisableAutoFakes|/DisableAutoFakes:<true/false> Example: /DisableAutoFakes:true

data.name: CollectWithTestSettingErrorMessage
data.value: --Collect|/Collect:"{0}" is not supported if test run is configured using testsettings.

data.name: RunsettingsWithDCErrorMessage
data.value: Data collectors other than Code Coverage and Microsoft Fakes configured via run settings are not supported with embedded test settings. Please see https://aka.ms/vstest-configure-datacollector for more information. Run settings: {0}.

data.name: EnableLoggerArgumentsInNetCore
data.value:
--logger|/logger:<Logger Uri/FriendlyName> Specify a logger for test results. For example, to log results into a Visual Studio Test Results File (TRX) use /logger:trx[;LogFileName=<Defaults to unique file name>] Creates file in TestResults directory with given LogFileName.
Change the verbosity level in log messages for console logger as shown below Example: /logger:console;verbosity=<Defaults to "minimal"> Allowed values for verbosity: quiet, minimal, normal and detailed.
Change the diagnostic level prefix for console logger as shown below Example: /logger:console;prefix=<Defaults to "false"> More info on Console Logger here : https://aka.ms/console-logger

data.value: The blame parameter specified with blame, {0} is invalid. Ignoring this parameter.

data.name: None
data.value: None

data.name: BlameCollectDumpTestTimeoutNotSupportedForPlatform
data.value: Collecting hang dumps by option CollectDump with TestTimeout for Blame is not supported for this platform.

data.name: EnvironmentArgumentHelp
data.value:
-e|--Environment|/e|/Environment:<NAME>=<VALUE> Sets the value of an environment variable. Creates the variable if it does not exist, overrides if it does. This will imply /InIsolation switch and force the tests to be run in an isolated process.
This argument can be specified multiple times to provide multiple variables.
Example: -e:VARIABLE1=VALUE1 -e:ANOTHER_VARIABLE="VALUE WITH SPACES" -e:ANOTHER_VARIABLE="VALUE;seperated with;semicolons"

data.name: EnvironmentVariableXIsOverriden
data.value: Environment variable '{0}' was already defined, but it's overridden by -Environment argument.

data.name: TestRunAbortedWithError
data.value: Test Run Aborted with error {0}.
